bio: Milton H. Greene was an American photographer and film producer who was active in the mid-20th century. He is best known for his portrait photography, which captured the glamour and charisma of many of the most famous celebrities of his time. Greene was born in New York City in 1922, and began his career as a photographer in the 1940s. He quickly gained recognition for his work, and became known for his ability to capture the essence of his subjects in his portraits. Greene's work appeared in a wide range of publications, including magazines and newspapers, and he worked with many of the leading figures of the entertainment industry, including Marilyn Monroe, Frank Sinatra, and Elizabeth Taylor. Greene is remembered as one of the most talented and influential photographers of his time, and his work continues to be highly regarded today.
